stories.text:
Somehow, we continue to disregard what is staring us right in our faces. Simply put, … the truth!

What truth? A couple, a couple of serious problems that is contributing to the self-destruction of the United States of America. Now, I would like to preface this with the fact that I hope this provokes you, because it should.

As an American, I have noticed that people have very fragile beliefs here. To the point that if challenged, it is almost as if they crumble or short circuit when confronted with something foreign to them. It makes sense but for one reason, most tend to fear the unknown to an irrational degree. This form of indoctrination of non-critical thinking or the inability to think for yourself starts from the second you come out of the womb, and into your parent's arms. They tell your truth, before you can observe it yourself to confirm, they fill your head with what they like; what they want you to be!

Then so do your teachers, politicians, etc. They force-feed us lies, in hopes that we will be more like themselves or our perception of what they represent to us. Then we are lied too once more and are trained to believe that there is any other race than human. Which is false, there is nothing racial about varying pigments, skin pigmentation is simply a result of the climate you are subjected too. But we are fighting and killing over race, religion, and man made beliefs, that did not begin with us and are scientifically false or implausible. For some reason we often try to disassociate from the fact that we are animals (Mammals), we self-domesticate, and think we need a government to survive and this is why we are such an easy people to brainwash, it’s a cultural thing! Actually, on an instinctual level human beings are very much like dogs, easy to train and are territorial. As far as I can tell, the animal kingdom was doing fine before us animals came into the picture, natural selection; it’s a thing.

So the reality of needing (God = Government) is actually not real at all, and this is merely another fundamental flaw in your ability to think with your own brain.

~ Om1n0us
stories.title: A breif rant about truth, and freedom of thought
US chip startup: Work with UK’s biggest plant stopped after Chinese takeover
New funding round sees Reddit gain $4B in valuation since February
How to Conduct a Developer Performance Review

stories.text:
Hey everyone, I'm the program director at TinySeed, a year-long remote accelerator specializing in SaaS startups. Our applications are now open for our Fall 2021 batch: https://tinyseed.com/latest/applications-open

Our program is designed to help founders with a revenue-generating SaaS optimize product-market fit and grow faster. Full program details: https://tinyseed.com/program

Our Fall 2021 batch will be our fourth batch. We've already seen great results from folks who went through our earlier years: - The 13 companies in our 2020 batch grew by an average of 413% during the accelerator year. — The company with the lowest starting MRR in that batch wound up with the highest percentage growth (1170%!) by the end of the program. - Our 2020 batch also included our first acquisition (congrats to SeekWell!)

TinySeed is a part of MicroConf and was founded by Rob Walling (Drip, Startups for the Rest of Us) and Einar Vollset (Discretion Capital, YC09 alum).

Send us an email at hello@tinyseed.com if you have any questions, or leave a comment here. Hope to see you apply!
stories.title: Applications are open for TinySeed's Fall 2021 bootstrapped SaaS accelerator
